headline: Boeing Stock Rises on $8 Billion Uzbekistan Deal. More Orders May Be on the Way.
summary: Boeing  stock gained on Tuesday after President Donald Trump said the aerospace company had signed an order from Uzbekistan for planes worth more than $8 billion.  Under the terms of the agreement, Uzbekistan Airways will purchase 14 787-9 airplanes, with the option for eight more.  Boeing  first announced the deal on Monday, noting that it was the airline’s single largest order to date.

headline: Should Lockheed Martin’s (LMT) New Autonomous Aircraft Partnerships Prompt Fresh Consideration From Investors?
summary: Earlier this month, Lockheed Martin Skunk Works unveiled Vectis, a new collaborative combat aircraft offering advanced survivability and mission flexibility, and announced a partnership with BAE Systems FalconWorks to develop modular, uncrewed autonomous air systems with electronic warfare capabilities. These developments highlight the company's increasing focus on next-generation autonomous and integrated defense solutions, underscoring its commitment to rapid innovation and global security...

headline: Terran Orbital Completes Delivery of Satellite Bus Platforms to Lockheed Martin for the Tranche 1 Transport Layer
